meanings.sent1: She would nictitate whenever she wanted to signal a secret message.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies would nictitate in the dark, creating a magical display.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, he tried to nictitate to his team to guess the word.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candle seemed to nictitate in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The old man would nictitate at the children, making them giggle.

meanings.definition: A quick closing and opening of the eye
meanings.sent1: His nictitate was so quick that it was almost imperceptible.
meanings.sent2: The owl's nictitate allowed it to see clearly in the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated nictitate added humor to his performance.
meanings.sent4: The camera captured the cat's nictitate in a split second.
meanings.sent5: The detective noticed a suspicious nictitate from the suspect during questioning.
